definition[0]: to talk to someone in a way which seems friendly but shows that you think they are not as intelligent or do not know as much as you
example[1]: The program focuses on kids’ interests without patronizing them.
definition[1]: to use or visit a shop, restaurant etc
definition[2]: to support or give money to an organization or activity
definition[3]: to use or visit a particular shop, restaurant, hotel etc
example[2]: Many homosexuals patronize gay-owned companies simply because they feel more comfortable there.
definition[4]: to speak to someone in a way that suggests that they are not as intelligent as you
example[3]: The agency has a reputation for patronizing clients who don’t agree with its creative ideas.
example[4]: The State patronizes the arts by designating ten thousand Kuwaiti Dinars annually for the selection and purchase of paintings by Kuwaiti artists.
